metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40426 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the sphere.cstart_read() functionality of Sound Exchange libsox 14.4.2 and mastercommit 42b3557e. A specially-crafted file can lead to a heap bufferoverflow. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
sox - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1').
